page.title: 18MARKET RASEN-HOUSING
page.content: West Lindsey district Council(taking its name from the pre-1974 county) provides housing for the people of Market and Middle Rasen(100 houses inMkt.Rasen). Recently some have passed into private ownership. There are also warden-controlled bungalows for the elderly on 2 sites in Market and 1 in Middle Rasen.In the last decade 2 new housing estates have been developed and another enlarged. The tendency is towards an influx of people worknig out of town - in some cases abroad.There remains the older established ribbon development along the main routes which has stretched to the limits of the old Urban District(pre-1974).There remains a need for more council housing as there is waiting list of over 500.
